age-group-description.title: How we assign a child to an age group
age-group-description.subtitle: When assigning the child to the age group, we calculate the child's metric age on the day of testing (with an accuracy of one month).
age-group-description.text-1: If a child is, for example, 4 years and 10 months old we classify him/her as a 5 year old. To the group
age-group-description.text-2: includes all children who = on the day of the survey - were
age-group-description.text-4: A similar principle applies to the qualification of children in other age groups.

child-profile.no-results-list-1: The initial test was not taken or the results are being elaborated.
child-profile.no-results-list-2: Your child was absent on the day of the initial test or was unable to take part in the test due to random reasons.
child-profile.no-results-list-3: Your child joined the Mali Wspaniali programme after the first test. The next fitness test will be taken in the spring.
child-profile.no-results-bottom: To find out what the fitness test looks like, visit the tab

about.panelTitle: About the Wrocław Preschool Test - a few words in general
about.title: The Preschooler Test is a very accessible fitness test for children aged 3-7.
about.text1: It is used to assess physical development. It is very simple to do in preschool settings. It does not require complicated and specialized measuring tools, rooms or devices.
about.text2-1: It consists of four physical tests, which in their results take into account the basic and most important motor skills:
about.text2-2: These abilities are used in sports, but also in everyday activities in adult life, such as: physical work, carrying shopping, cleaning or even taking things out of a hard-to-reach place.

conditions.panelTitle: How do we perform the preschooler test and calculate its results?
conditions.title: The preschooler's fitness test is performed once a semester.
conditions.text1: It consists of two tests: the initial test (measurement at the turn of October and November) and the final test (measurement at the turn of April and May). Each sample has four components, the sum of which makes the total score. This result gives an indication of your child's fitness level.
conditions.text2: A certain number of points is assigned for each trial. Children are assessed according to a scale prepared by international experts in the field of mobility among children, which shows the minimum and maximum results calculated for a given age and gender. For strength tests (strength and power), the greater the distance the child has covered during the test, the more points he/she will receive, while in the case of agility tests (speed and agility), more points will be awarded to the child with shorter execution time.
conditions.text3: The sum of points makes up the total score. This result signifies your child's fitness level (low, medium, good or very good). The results are collected from children who are present at the facility and willing to participate in the Mali Wspaniali classes held by the Instructor. A missing trial result may be due to child's absence that day or to non-participation in a given exercise. In this case, you receive individual test results without insights into child's overall fitness.
conditions.test1-description: 4 x 5 m shuttle run while carrying a brick

results.score50: You're doing well, but it can always be better!
results.title: The conducted research is not diagnostic, but only illustrative.
results.text1: Your child's score may vary from day to day. It is influenced by a number of physical and psychological factors. Therefore, the results should not be treated as an accurate source of knowledge about the child's fitness, but even a visual control of physical development is extremely important due to the healthy and proper course of shaping the human body and its future possibilities.
results.text2: Thanks to appropriate motivation and learning by means of repeated repetition of exercises, the child continously improves specific skills, verified as motor skills in the preschooler test.
results.text3: The optimal results of the child, and thus a healthy and harmonious motor development, allows the child to gradually achieve its own independence and safety, and subsequently self-confidence. It can also have an impact on social acceptance.
results.text4: Lack of movement can cause internal imbalances in a child's body, which can result in inappropriate behavior, tension or emotional resignation, and mood swings. Physical fitness is not only helpful for sports and physical education, it is also a major factor in living a happy life to the fullest.

interpretation.panelTitle: What factors can contribute to a low test result
interpretation.title1: General factors that can contribute to a low test result:
interpretation.title2: Individual factors that can contribute to a low test result:
interpretation.text1: Lack of motivation among participants or in the environment
interpretation.text2: Conditions inside and outside the facility (not necessarily unfavorable)
interpretation.text3: Daytime (e.g. after a meal, resting or other activities)
interpretation.text4: External difficulties (e.g. behavior of other children)
interpretation.text6: Injury (e.g. fracture, sprain, bruise) within the last 30 days
interpretation.text7: Serious illness of the child requiring hospitalization within the last 6 months
interpretation.text10: Subjective barriers on the part of the child (e.g. physical or mental ones)

recommendations.panel-title: Recommendation  - How to improve child's fitness
recommendations.title: Remember about daily activities
recommendations.text1-3: 180 minutes of physical activities of any intensity throughout the day.
recommendations.text1-4: a variety of activities and games in various environments (on the playground, at home, in the woods, in a gym, in the water) and activities developing motor skills (throwing, grabbing, jumping, running, climbing, bouncing, ...).
recommendations.subtitle1: Any form is good for everyday joint activity!
recommendations.text2: Children aged 5-11 should play vigorously or be physically active for at least 60 minutes every day. At least 3 days a week, the activity should include high-intensity play / exercise to strengthen muscles and bones.
recommendations.subtitle2: 60 minutes a day - you can help your child achieve it!
recommendations.text3: The more of daily physical activity, the greater the health benefits now and in the future.
recommendations.subtitle3: Sleep is key to health and development:
recommendations.text4: Preschoolers aged 3-5 should sleep 10 to 13 hours a day, while children aged 6-13 - 9 to 11 hours.

agreements.heading: Manage consents granted to the Mali Wspaniali Foundation. Have full control over the security of your personal data, being able to increase or limit the rights granted at any time.
agreements.title: Below you can check and edit the signed agreements.
agreements.Image-title: Consent for gratuitous processing of your child's image by the Mali Wspaniali Foundation.
agreements.Image-description-1: Consent for gratuitous processing of your child's image by the Mali Wspaniali Foundation, registered in Wrocław, at Ślężna Street 2-24, 53-302 Wrocław, as part of its operations. This consent will allow us to share our success stories and to promote our Foundation by publishing child's image by means of pictures and films: photo-coverage in media (press, TV), web portals, and sites administred by the Foundation.
agreements.Image-description-2: This consent will enable you to see your kid in materials from classes published by the Foundation.
agreements.Image-description-3: Consent does not affect processing of child's/ children's image during group classes. We have the right to use the image when a child is photographed/ filmed as part of the group. The consent is voluntary and participation in the program does not depend on it.
agreements.Marketing-title: Consent for receiving marketing information at the e-mail address provided.
agreements.Marketing-description-1: Consent to process your e-mail adress for marketing and commercial purposes by the Mali Wspaniali Foundation, registered in Wrocław, at Ślężna Street 2-24, 53-302 Wrocław. This consent will allow us to send you e-mails with up-to-date information about the Mali Wspaniali program.
agreements.Marketing-description-2: Sometimes we will share our success stories.
agreements.Marketing-description-3: Consent is voluntary and participation in the program does not depend on it.
agreements.general-title: Consent to participate in the Mali Wspaniali program.
agreements.general-description: Consent for child's participation in general sports activities with elements of karate as part of the Mali Wspaniali program is obligatory. You can cancel your child's involvement in the Mali Wspaniali program any time. To this end, please contact the Foundation by sending the resignation to the e-mail address: biuro@mali-wspaniali.pl.

home-page-content.check-children-activity: Check out the children's activity in the programme
home-page-content.foundation-content: We are a foundation from Wrocław that coordinates general sports activities with elements of karate in your child's kindergarten. Instructors conducting trainings focus primarily on cheerful, safe and active play, and supporting the harmonious development of your child. An inseparable element of the 'Mali Wspaniali' program are also tests of children's fitness. On the platform you will find test results that your child achieved in subsequent attempts, you will learn further recommendations and you will receive information about the development of children aged 3-6 that may be of interest to you.
